content:
The image is a healthy organic porridge topped with a variety of fresh berries, such as raspberries, blueberries, and blackberries, as well as some nuts and seeds, possibly almonds, chia seeds, or flaxseeds.

Here's the updated table with a brief description and the numbered column:

| # | Ingredient | FODMAP Content | Specific FODMAP |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| 1 | Oats (rolled or instant) | Low FODMAP (in moderate servings) | Fructans (in larger servings) |
| 2 | Regular milk | High FODMAP | Lactose |
| 3 | Lactose-free milk | Low FODMAP | N/A |
| 4 | Almond milk | Low FODMAP (in moderate servings) | GOS (in larger servings) |
| 5 | Soy milk (made from soy protein) | Low FODMAP | N/A |
| 6 | Raspberries | Low FODMAP | Fructose (in larger servings) |
| 7 | Blueberries | Low FODMAP | Fructose (in larger servings) |
| 8 | Blackberries | High FODMAP | Fructose |
| 9 | Almonds | Low FODMAP (in moderate servings) | GOS (in larger servings) |
| 10 | Chia seeds | Low FODMAP (in moderate servings) | N/A |
| 11 | Flaxseeds | Low FODMAP (in moderate servings) | Fructans (in larger servings) |

Keep in mind that the FODMAP content of different milk alternatives may vary depending on the specific product used, and individual tolerance to FODMAPs can also vary. Monitor your body's reaction to different ingredients and adjust your diet as needed.
